intro: Quararibea oblongifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark wood and aromatic leaves. The plant has elliptical, leathery leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an endangered species in its natural habitat.
